#summary Sandbox for HTML5 dictionary markup.

{{{
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<html xmlns:epub="http://www.idpf.org/2007/ops" xmlns:ssml="http://www.w3.org/2001/10/synthesis" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" profile="http://www.idpf.org/epub/30/profile/content/" ssml:alphabet="ipa">
<head>
<style type="text/css">
dfn {font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-size: 125%;}
.entry {display: block; margin-bottom: 2em; margin-left: 2em; text-indent: -2em;}
.derived-form-block {display: block; margin-top: 0.75em; margin-bottom: 0em; margin-left: 1em; text-indent: -1.5em;}
.sense-block {display: block; margin-top: 0.375em; margin-bottom: 0em; margin-left: 1em; text-indent: -1.5em;}
.runon {display: block;}
.misc-label {font-style: italic;}
.usage-label {font-style: italic; font-weight: bold;}
.disp-infl {font-weight: bold;}
.sn {font-weight: bold;}
.normal {font-style:normal;}
.ex {color: purple;}
</style>
</head>

<body epub:type="dictionary">

<!--added line breaks for clarity, omitting search metadata section--> 
<article class="entry">
  <dfn title="color"><sup>1</sup>col·or</dfn> 
  <span epub:type="pron" ssml:ph="ˈkələr">\ˈkə-lər\</span>  
  <span epub:type="pos" class="misc-label">n</span>,  <span class="misc-label">often attrib</span> 
  <span epub:type="etym">[<small>ORIGIN</small>: ME <span class="misc-label">colour,</span> fr. AF, fr. L <span class="misc-label">color;</span> akin to L <span class="misc-label">celare</span> to conceal — more at <a href="#DUMMY"><small>HELL</small></a>]</span>
  <span class="normal">(13c)</span>
  <div class="sense-block">
    <span epub:type="sense"> <span epub:type="sensenum" class="sn" title="1a">1 a</span> <span epub:type="def">: a phenomenon of light (as red, brown, pink, or gray) or visual perception that enables one to differentiate otherwise identical objects</span></span>
    <span epub:type="sense"> <span epub:type="sensenum" class="sn" title="1b(1)">b <span class="normal">(1)</span></span> <span epub:type="def">: the aspect of the appearance of objects and light sources that may be described in terms of hue, lightness, and saturation for objects and hue, brightness, and saturation for light sources <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;the changing ∼ of the sky&gt;</span></span>; <span class="misc-label">also</span> <span epub:type="def">: a specific combination of hue, saturation, and lightness or brightness <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;comes in six ∼<span class="misc-label">s</span>&gt;</span></span></span>
    <span epub:type="sense"> <span epub:type="sensenum" class="sn" title="1b(2)"><span class="normal">(2)</span></span> <span epub:type="def">: a color other than and as contrasted with black, white, or gray</span></span>
  </div>
  <div class="sense-block">
    <span epub:type="sense"> <span epub:type="sensenum" class="sn" title="2a">2 a</span> <span epub:type="def">: an outward often deceptive show : <a href="#DUMMY"><small>APPEARANCE</small></a> <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;his story has the ∼ of truth&gt;</span></span></span>
    <span epub:type="sense"> <span epub:type="sensenum" class="sn" title="2b">b</span> <span epub:type="def">: a legal claim to or appearance of a right, authority, or office</span></span>
    <span epub:type="sense"> <span epub:type="sensenum" class="sn" title="2c">c</span> <span epub:type="def">: a pretense offered as justification : <a href="#DUMMY"><small>PRETEXT</small></a> <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;she could have drawn from the Versailles treaty the ∼ of legality for any action she chose  —<span class="misc-label">Yale Rev.</span>&gt;</span></span></span> 
    <span epub:type="sense"> <span epub:type="sensenum" class="sn" title="2d">d</span> <span epub:type="def">: an appearance of authenticity : <a href="#DUMMY"><small>PLAUSIBILITY</small></a> <span epub:type="ex" class="ex">&lt;lending ∼ to this notion&gt;</span></span></span>
  </div>
  <div class="sense-block">
    <span epub:type="sense"> <span epub:type="sensenum" class="sn" title="3">3</span> <span epub:type="def"> : complexion tint:</span></span> 
    <span epub:type="sense"> <span epub:type="sensenum" class="sn" title="3a">a</span> <span epub:type="def">: the tint characteristic of good health</span></span> 
    <span epub:type="sense"> <span epub:type="sensenum" class="sn" title="3b">b</span> <span epub:type="def">: <a href="#DUMMY"><small>BLUSH</small></a> </span></span>
  </div>
  <div class="sense-block">
    <span epub:type="sense"> <span epub:type="sensenum" class="sn" title="4a">4 a</span> <span epub:type="def">: vividness or variety of effects of language</span></span> 
    <span epub:type="sense"> <span epub:type="sensenum" class="sn" title="4b">b</span> <span epub:type="def">: <a href="#DUMMY"><small>LOCAL COLOR</small></a></span></span>
  </div>
  <!-- [snip] -->
  <div class="sense-block">
    <span epub:type="sense"> <span epub:type="sensenum" class="sn" title="15">15</span> <span epub:type="def">: a hypothetical property of quarks that differentiates each type into three forms having a distinct role in binding quarks together</span></span>
  </div>
</article>

<article class="entry">
  <dfn title="colour">col·our</dfn> 
  <span epub:type="pron" ssml:ph="ˈkələr">\ˈkə-lər\</span>
  <span class="misc-label">chiefly Brit var of</span> <a href="#DUMMY"><small>COLOR</small></a>
</article>

</body>
</html>
